qas.question: How many people were living in the Palermo area in 2010?

plausible_answers.text: people living in the greater Palermo area,

qas.question: Who's average age is 42.8 in Palermo?
What has increased in Palermo from 2001 to 2010?
Who has a slightly higher birth rate than Palermo?

context: In <b4_0>2010<b4_0/>, there were <a0_0>1.2 million<a0_0/> <b5_0>people living in the greater Palermo area,<b5_0/> 655,875 of which resided in the City boundaries, of whom 47.4% were male and <a1_0>52.6%<a1_0/> were female. People under age 15 totalled 15.6% compared to pensioners who composed 17.2% of the population. This compares with the Italian average of 14.1% people under 15 years and 20.2% pensioners. The average age of a Palermo <b6_0>resident<b6_0/> is <a2_0>40.4<a2_0/> compared to the Italian average of 42.8. In the ten years between 2001 and 2010, the population of Palermo declined by 4.5%, while the population of <b8_0>Italy<b8_0/>, as a whole, grew by 6.0%. The reason for Palermo's decline is a <a3_0><b7_0>population<b7_0/> flight to the suburbs<a3_0/>, and to Northern Italy. The current birth rate of Palermo is 10.2 births per 1,000 inhabitants compared to the Italian average of 9.3 births.
